title: CATE LE BON

title: CC SMUGGLERS

title: CC SMUGGLERS

title: CHANCE THE RAPPER
description: Having performed on a host of other people’s records – James Blake, Skrillex, Childish Gambino, Lil Wayne, even Justin ‘Bad Boy’ Bieber - Chance The Rapper steps out on his own on the back of last year’s ‘Acid Rap’ mix tape. Expect some eclectic samples and some heavyweight LA storytelling for the ghetto Glasto.

title: CHARLI XCX
description: Anyone who is an exponent of witch house is good with Glastonbury – of course. Mix in synthpop, darkwave and indietronica and you’ll have an idea of just where Charli is coming from.

title: CHE SUDAKA
description: Barcelona-based four piece whose mix of cumbia and punk is very reminiscent of Manu Chao. Outspoken and sounding like they are in mid party mode, this should be a spectacular appearance, expect sudden fast paced rap outbreaks too.

title: CHERUB
description: Hook-laden electro pop from this Nashville duo with more than few idiosyncratic laughs along the way.

title: CHLÖE HOWL
description: 19-year-old BRITS Critics’ Choice nominee with an electro pop sound and some feather light vocals that accentuate her tender years.

title: CHVRCHES
description: The feeling of austerity continues with Chvrches, and their old school barrage of synths behind Lauren Mayberry’s vocal. Think Depeche Mode in the early ‘80s with Dave Gahan replaced by a sweet Scottish brogue. And no leather trousers.

title: CIRCA WAVES
description: If you put lots of elements from the great days of indie pop into a blender - jangling guitars, singalong choruses, a few pointed life messages and a hint of math rock cleverness - you’d make an audio milkshake a bit like this uplifting four piece.

title: CLANNAD

title: CLEAN BANDIT
description: Plundering classical strings, deep house and synthpop to make a kind of modern baroque pop sound on ‘Mozart’s House’, the Bandit’s biggest success came with the Jess Glynne fronted ‘Rather Be’, which used a similarly eclectic mix of sounds.

title: CLUB DE FROMAGE
description: Bringing back the days of stilettos on the dancefloor and gin and tonics at the bar... join club legends (and close friends of Abba and Dot Cotton) Fat Tony and his son Slow Alfie for a complete cheese fest!

title: COMEDY WITH MARK STEEL
description: The social columnist, author, occasional lecturer and stand up comedian with more than a few theories on what’s going on and what we can do about it.

title: COMEDY WITH ROBIN INCE

title: CONGO NATTY

title: COURTNEY BARNETT

title: COURTNEY BARNETT
description: Much praised Australian singer songwriter. Pitchfork says: “Barnett’s music builds on the wordy irreverence of mid-’60s Bob Dylan and a Byrds-ian blend of psychedelia, folk and country.” No pressure there then.

title: CRAIG RICHARDS

title: CREDIT TO THE NATION
description: Nirvana samplers with an edgy line in political rhetoric.

title: CRYSTAL FIGHTERS
description: A band named after an unfinished opera whose last album was about people having creative experiences in caves, Crystal Fighters have a high brow but suitably unhinged take on things. They look like they’ve been brought here from another time and their rhythmic psyche-dance is as much ravecentric as it is a throwback to 1969. Foppish fun.

title: DAN HYDE
description: Emotionally wracked tales of love and other evenings out, given a huge production with a dry, almost deadpan and moody delivery.

title: DAN LE SAC VS SCROOBIUS PIP
description: Pairing the heavy beats and powerhouse electronic sound of Dan Le Sac and the incisive poetry and prose of Scroobius Pip, these festival regulars return on the back of their new opus ‘Repent Replenish Repeat’. Not to be missed! And a great beard.

title: DANNY & THE CHAMPIONS OF THE WORLD
description: Checked shirt! Check. Amazingly Danny Wilson is now on his eleventh album (another five stars from Q) of virtuoso UK Americana. The voice remains the key, as band members come and go, the end result is always a top-notch live experience.

title: DANNY BROWN
description: Highly-rated (Rolling Stone, etc) Detroit hip hop star with a fine line in samples and some fast paced rhyming not to mention an esoteric line in guest vocalists.

title: DARK BELLS
description: Swirling psychedelia with a heavy bass thud, phasers on full and a dizzying echoey lead guitar and vocal. Like Loop meeting early Floyd – weird!

title: DARLIA
description: Grouped with Drenge and Superfood as pioneers of a ‘90s style rock revival, Darlia play it loud, far louder than you could imagine a trio of Blackpool youths could do in fact. Noisey in a way that makes jumping around haphazardly seem sensible.

title: DELTRON 3030

title: DERVISH

description: DRUMSOUND and bassline smith , Always looking to evolve their sound, they incorporate dubstep and electro influences along with their trademark D&B sound.

title: DRY THE RIVER
description: Hard travelling, constantly gigging folk prog homeboys whose rootsy vibe underpins their slowly building songs. They are masters of the euphoric crescendo and with the wind in the direction and the ley line buzzing from the Tor this could just be their night.

title: DRY THE RIVER
description: Much tattooed and travelled, festival friendly band whose amalgamation of rootsy folk, prog fervor and psychedelic phrasing creates a swirling soundbed for Peter Liddle’s tortured vocals.

title: DUB PISTOLS
description: Chewing up hip-hop, dub, techno, ska & punk & spitting them out in a renegade futuristic skank they have consistently defied genres

title: DUB SMUGGLERS SOUND SYSTEM
description: Top rankin’, champion skankin’ dub and reggae lovers spinning the sounds.

title: DUBKASM
description: Original purveyors of digital dub back in the ‘90s and still at the heart of the roots and dub scene.

title: DUOLOGUE

title: ED SHEERAN
description: Will the ginger prince be able to follow the irresistible Dolly? Of course he will. Expect the boy with the acoustic to roll out his folky dance-friendly sounds and build the evening to a suitable climax. Foppish and fun.

title: EDWIN BROOKES AND THE BURNING GLASS

description: Following five star reviews for their latest album, ‘The Take Off And Landing Of Everything’, Elbow return to their spiritual home of Glastonbury for a performance that promises to be suitably euphoric and undoubtedly epic. Throw those curtains wide!

title: ELLA EYRE

title: ELLE & THE POCKET BELLES WITH MISTA TRICK- ELECTRO SWING

description: Elle and The Pocket Belles taking you back to the time of speakeasy's and dance halls  their unique swingin' vintage swing music.

title: ELLIE GOULDING

That said, her chart topping ‘Halcyon’ album only reached number 85 in France – that’s Eurovision for you.

title: ELLIPHANT
description: A Diplo and Skrillex-approved Swedish singer with an innovative mix of styles that hint at everything from MIA and rap to R&B and reggae.

title: EMILÍANA TORRINI

title: EMPEROR MACHINE
description: Ambitious bulky, ballsy disco made perfect with the addition of twanging guitars and the sound of flying spaceships taking it to another dimension altogether.

title: ENGLISH NATIONAL BALLET
description: So, Glastonbury hosted opera a few years back, it dabbled in thrash metal last night and Jay Z was a tad controversial, The English National Ballet should have no problems.

title: ESG
description: Legendary ‘70s US all-girl funky indie trio, Emerald, Sapphire And Gold, still retain that post punk edginess and dancefloor shuffle of old, like an edgier version of Tom Tom Club with great songs.

title: ETERNAL TAAL BHANGRA ENTERTAINMENT TEAM
description: More authentic pulsating dhol drummers with dancers and DJs in an all out attack on the senses.

title: ETERNAL TAAL BHANGRA ENTERTAINMENT TEAM
description: Authentic pulsating dhol drummers with dancers and DJs in an all out attack on the senses. A visual feast.

title: ETHAN JOHNS
description: Producer (Macca, Kings Of Leon, Laura Marling, Ryan Adams) turned performer with a spirited take on Americana with a dollop of southern fried country and a bit of vaudeville mixed in for good measure.

title: ETON MESSY
description: The former YouTube channel mainstay and half of Blonde with an undying love of eclectic electronic music.

title: ETON MESSY
description: The former YouTube channel mainstay and half of Blonde with an undying love of eclectic electronic music.

title: ETTA BOND
description: Vocalist of choice with both DaVinche, Plan B, Wretch 32 and Devlin among others, now working with raf Riley.

title: FAMILY OF THE YEAR
description: There’s more than a hint of melancholy to some of Family Of The Year’s music, and the seven million plus viewed video for ‘Hero’ suggests that their aching Americana has touched more than a few hearts along the way.

title: FAT WHITE FAMILY
description: Catch them early before the weekend catches them, the much talked about FWF, prone to yobbish good humour, nudity and wild irreverence are set to be one of the most talked about things this weekend.

title: FAT WHITE FAMILY
description: Controversial South London squat rockers with a propensity for nudity in their videos. The Guardian introduced them so: “Like all great bands Fat White Family look like trouble.” Words like “yobbish” and “Libertines”, “pub” and “The Birthday Party” followed.

title: FATBOY SLIM
description: The big beat brother and acclaimed remix artist whose groundbreaking ‘You’ve Come A Long Way Baby’ album from 1998 still sound as good today. Right here, right now – all that stuff.

title: FINDLAY
description: Whoa! Imagine if Sonic Youth were all inside one person and they were emerging now into a world of new tech with traditional musical walls broken down – they’d sound like this. Sassy.

title: FISHERMAN'S FRIENDS
description: Where would we be without a quick sea shanty? Port Isaac’s Fisherman’s Friends have been spreading new life into the genre for nearly ten years now and their multi-harmonies and choice of material never fail to impress.

title: FLIGHTS OF HELIOS
description: Exceptional and odd, bringing evocative hints of Elysian 60’s pop like the Zombies to some serenely medicated Spiritualized passages

title: FOSTER THE PEOPLE
description: Did ‘Pumped Up Kicks’ really come out in 2010? Time has flown for this neo-psychedelic indietronica pop trio with a bass player called “Cubbie” Fink. New album ‘Supermodel’ suggests more of the same soulful stuff for sure. What were his parents thinking?

title: FOUR TET
description: Multi-layered, genre-defying electronic music from Kieran Hebden, an evocative and pulsating journey into your psyche with sounds that envelop the listener and, as the sun disappears over The Park, the perfect way to unwind – completely.

title: FOXES
description: One more mention of Rudimental! Foxes was guest vocalist on ‘Right Here’, she also won a Grammy Award for ‘Clarity’ with Zedd. Since then, the diminuitive vocalist has had some huge tracks all of her own including the glorious anthem ‘Holding Onto Heaven’.

title: FRANK SANAZI HOSTS THE PIT CABARET FEATURING KITTY BANG BANG & THE MOSTERS OF SCHLOCK
FUJIYA & MIYAGI
description: Mixing Krautrock with techno synths, with whispered vocals and a sequencer gone mad. If Can went to Ibiza in its heyday it might have sounded something like this.

title: FURS
description: The London trio who released the magical single ‘Just Kids’, a proper slice of new indie pop, with a great vocal and so much going on around the melody line that its hugely contagious.

title: GABRIELLE APLIN
description: With a staggering 41 million views on Youtube and a number one single with her version of ‘The Power Of Love’, Gabrielle Aplin’s brittle vocal and aching delivery is all about tingling the spine.

title: GALIA ARAD
description: Yes! A gifted American singer songwriter based in Dublin with the kind of maturity in her lyrics and voice that you might not expect from someone who looks so young. Clever, quirky and a touch eccentric, just about perfect.

title: GALLERY CIRCUS
description: Drums, guitar, aggression! A nod to Jack White, Black Keys and a secret smattering of old school metal bands from this chunkily riffed duo.

title: GARDEN CITY MOVEMENT
description: Soft dreamy electronic sounds from this Israeli three-piece who, on occasion, sound like the perfect audio example of slow-motion.

title: GARDEN PARTY WITH NORMSKI AND FRIENDS
GAZ COOMBES
description: The former Supergrass man is readying himself for his second solo album, recent singles suggesting that he’s found a deeper more emotional and expressive edge to his music.

title: GENERAL LEVY WITH DJ JOE ARIWA
description: Ragga master General Levy with dub sparring partner Joe Ariwa for this special DJ set spiked with Levy rhymes.

title: GENGAHR
description: Echoey sub-psyche nudging into dreamy indie pop in the style of Unknown Mortal Orchestra with two great tracks on YouTube.

title: GENTLE MYSTICS
description: a trio which miraculously tripled into a full blown 9-piece band with a finished album and every musical instrument under the sun, almost

title: GENTLEMAN'S DUB CLUB
description: Be-suited Two Tone-styled ska in the realms of Madness and The Specials with some clever wordplay and plenty of socially commentary in the mix.

title: GEORGE EZRA
description: Complete with a Bristol twang, spinning yarns and stories into melodic pop while also doffing a cap to the blues crooners of old.

title: GEORGE EZRA
description: In the wake of Ginger Ed, we have the man Bugg and now George Ezra replete with a Bristol twang, spinning yarns and stories into melodic pop places. But wait, guitar discarded it’s like listening to an old blues man singing spirituals, raising hairs where no hairs should be. A talent for sure. Young, good looking, got nothing going for him.

title: GHETTO FUNK ALLSTARS FT TIGERLIGHT, PROFIT&NATTY
GIBSON BULL
description: A finalist in this year’s Glastonbury Festival Emerging Talent Competition, this London based singer-songwriter fuses indie folk with trip hop for maximum atmosphere.

title: GIRLS MUSIC WITH TODDLA T, MS DYNAMITE, ROBBO RANX, AC!D FACE, MELE & SLICK DON, DRS AND MORE
GLASS ANIMALS
description: Hard to define trippy soul music, with tongue-tied wordplays from Dave Bayley who claims his songs sound like a “man-made wilderness.” Yeah, we get that. Definitely worth checking out.

title: GLITCHES
description: The introspection continues with Glitches, a trio whose music is like a group therapy session. Stories emerge, characters are built, tales are told and it’s all set to music and sung by a man with a moustache.

title: GO CHIC
description: Lo-fi shouty electro pop from an all-female Taiwan five-piece as much old school Kleenex punk as it is modern day electronica. Mental!

title: GOLDFRAPP
description: Having evolved through trip hop, shiny electro pop, glam rock and the organic folksiness of 2008’s ‘Seventh Tree’, Goldfrapp are nothing short of unpredictable. Producer and composer Will Gregory and the beguiling Alison Goldfrapp will be reaching back through a 15-year back catalogue laden with classics for this Saturday evening slot.

title: GONNE CHOI
description: Singer songwriter from Seoul in Korea with a breathtaking range whose vocal sounds like a harmonious mix of Carly Simon and Carole King at the peak of their ‘70s success.

title: GONNE CHOI
description: A second chance to see this singer songwriter from Seoul in Korea with a breathtaking range whose vocal sounds like a harmonious mix of Carly Simon and Carole King at the peak of their ‘70s success.

title: GORGON CITY
description: Deep house, UK garage and electronic music are all in the mix from this north London production duo. After a string of singles their debut album is due with collaborations with Kiesza, Bipolar Sunshine, Jess Glynne, Josh Record, George Maple, Vicktor Taiwo and Jacob Banks.

title: GRAMATIK
description: New York-based Slovenian producer adding new dimensions to the EDM scene and gaining a huge following through torrenting his tunes.

title: GRINGO SKA
description: Gringo Ska have kept to these roots with a lively, high tuned, drum kit leap, rock-solid bass lines and the sharp, off-beat guitar chops that set the feet moving. Grooving on top are the melody lines, taken up by fruity sax and high altitude flute - a jazzy feel and plenty of improvisation

title: GUITAR MASTERCLASS, STEVE KNIGHTLEY, RODNEY BRANIGAN & GUESTS
GUTTTERFUNK CLOSING PARTY WITH DJ DIE, ADDISON GROOVE, ARTWORK, DISMANTLE, JENNA G, LAMINATE RADIO AND HOSTED BY INJA
HAIM
description: Acclaimed as “goofy” and “awesome”, the three sisters Haim had a number one album in the UK with their ‘Days Are Gone’ album and did a top show at The Park last year, expect more Californian dreaming and ethereal harmonies. Wear flowers in your hair!

title: HANNAH WANTS
description: From DJing in Ibiza in 2012 to a string of jackin’ house and bass mixes including the much-spun ‘Dappy’, Ms Wants has gone from strength to strength.

title: HAZEL O'CONNOR
description: Pop punk icon discovering her Celtic roots with harpist Cormac de Barra.

title: HAZEL O'CONNOR
description: Expect an eclectic mix from the former pop punk princess. Her recent album hinted at jazzy pop with a nod to Kirsty MacColl and she’s currently revisiting her Celtic roots but no doubt she’ll be up for a bit of ‘Breaking Glass’-styled futurism too.

title: HELTER SKELTER, CASTLE AND PIRATE SHIP
HERO FISHER
description: There’s something a little bit unsettling about Hero Fisher’s vocals. It sounds like she’s bearing her soul and, I suspect she is. Like a female Leonard Cohen with plenty of irony rolled up in there too, she’s well worth checking out.

title: HOBO JONES & THE JUNKYARD DOGS
description: Off the rails skiffle and laugh merchants with a West Country brogue and compulsory beards.

title: HOBO JONES AND THE JUNKYARD DOGS
HOLLIE COOK
description: Daughter of the Pistols' drummer who's skanked it up with Prince Fatty as well as being a part time member of The Slits.

title: HOLLY WILLIAMS
description: The grand daughter of the original country troubadour Hank Williams, Holly was raised in Nashville and has assimilated the best elements of that music scene into her own aching country sound.

title: HOSPITALITY TAKE OVER: METRIK B2B FRED V & GRAFIX, LONDON ELEKTRICITY B2B HIGH CONTRAST, HOSTED BY DYNAMITE MC
HOSTED BY MC CHICKABOO (SOUL II SOUL)
HOSTED BY MC CHICKABOO (SOUL II SOUL)
HOSTED BY NORMSKI
description: The legendary broadcaster, DJ and presenter...

title: HOT SINCE 82
description: Slow and sensuous shifting house sounds from the modestly named Daley Padley (he was born in ’82, see).

title: HOUSE GOSPEL CHOIR
description: Time to raise the roof with a proper Gospel Choir for Sunday evening. It’s the Songs Of Praise slot. Next up – Antiques Roadshow.

title: HOZIER
description: The huge viral success of ‘Take Me To The Church’ almost overshadowed Hozier’s other tunes but his ‘From Eden’ EP suggests that there’s a lot more to come and ‘Work Song’s neo-gospel feel and bluesy rhythm suggests that he’s one to watch.

title: HOZIER
description: The Irish singer whose ‘Take Me To the Church’ video is at 3 million plus views on YouTube, with a nod to Tom Waits, Paul Simon and Muddy Waters and the crossroads of folk and soul.

title: HUDSON TAYLOR
description: Irish duo armed with acoustic guitars and layers of beautiful harmonies forging songs of sizeable anthemic proportions.

title: HUNNЇ VǑN TRAPP ( AKA NICK FIELD) HOSTS THE PIT CABARET
IAIN HOSSACK – SUSTAINABILITY IN THE STARS
IMAGINE DRAGONS
description: Ah, keep the lighters out, I can see the BBC panning shot across the crowd as this Vegas combo break into their monumental mover ‘Night Visions’ all achy and breaky beneath Dan Reynolds’ groggy vocal. Expect several couples to declare undying love during their set.

title: INFINITY INK FEAT LUCA C AND ALI LOVE
INTERPOL
description: Another trio! The fourth lot – surely there’s something mystical there. Expect echoey and suitably dark post punk contemplation from this New York outfit whose last album was the much-praised self-titled opus back in 2010.

title: IZZY BIZU
description: With a vocal range that allows her to float precariously over the simplest of melodies, Izzy Bizu is an astonishing singer whose songs sound like Billie Holiday meets Ben Howard.

title: JACK WHITE
description: With a new solo album, expect an across the board run through his back pages – White Stripes et al – plus lots of new swaggering blues rock for the 2010’s. If initial sneaked previews are to be believed, ‘Lazaretto’ is riff-heavy with a nod to the great fuzzed guitarists of old. One for the heads!

title: JACKMASTER AND ONEMAN PRESENT CAN U DANCE
JAGWAR MA
description: Psychedelic dance music from down under courtesy of this duo who were inspired by everything from Motown to electronica. The result is a heady brew of soulful alternative trip hoppery.

title: JAGWAR MA
description: Psychedlic dance music from down under courtesy of this duo who were inspired by everything from Motown to electronica. The result is a heady brew of soulful alternative trip hoppery.

title: JAKE BUGG
description: Last year, he came, he saw, he smoked a few tabs. Jake Bugg plays twice again this year, but this headline slot promises to be something very special from the Nottingham singer songwriter with an acidic wit and some snarling off the cuff one liners. Hit the north!

title: JAKE BUGG
description: After headlining the Peel tent, Jake Bugg opts for a more intimate Sunday afternoon set for his second appearance of the weekend. Get there early.

title: JAKE ISAAC
description: MOBO nominated strummer with a deep and soulful voice, like Richie Havens after a few cigars, with some big choruses and a few broekn strings along the way. A great way to start Saturday.

title: JAMBINAI
description: Korean traditional instruments – the haegeum, piri and geomungo – mixed with guitar and electronics to make a post-hardcore avant garde mantra that’s unlike anything you’ll hear all weekend.

title: JAMES BAY
description: Weaned on the West Coast Americana of Crosby, Stills, Nash and James Taylor, this 22-year-old singer songwriter is equipped with an assured gritty vocal and some suitably warm summer strumming.

title: JAMES BLAKE
description: The live mix of James Blake’s exotic soulful vocal and the ground moving electronic throb from his tip hop meets post dubstep bass lines delivers is something to behold. It’s that use of light and dark that makes him a must see.

title: JAMES MONRO
description:
The Legendary James Monro of Flying Rhino and Grant Collins of Excession (and formerly Darshan) are still hard at work providing sonic delight all over the world. James’s mixing skills are second to none and he is one of the only men that make 2 decks sound like 4!
James is always on the road with his worldwide schedule and has lost no love for his craft over the many years he’s been doing it. Well known for his 8hour sets, his ability to create unheard grooves is second to none.

title: JAMIE JONES & SETH TROXLER
description: A classic face off between these two heavyweight DJs, with Hot Natured’s Jamie Jones sparring with the American underground house and techno extrovert Seth Troxler.

title: JAMIE XX
description: The xx beat maker, producer and go-to remix man with an eclectic selection of sounds.

title: JEN & ALLY DJ SET
description: Radio 1 DJs live on stage.

title: JENNY JONES & MERRICK BADGER - UNDERCOVER POLICING
JESS GLYNNE
description: Smooth soulful singer-songwriter who came to prominence at the start of this year when lending her vocal to Clean Bandit’s ‘Rather Be’.

title: JIMI GOODWIN
description: The man from Doves now out on his own with a new album of well strummed, thought provoking tales of northern life delivered in a glorious knowing snarl.

title: JIMMY DAVIS & THE BAREFOOT APOSTLES
description: Socially aware rapper backed by a funky soul outfit.

title: JINX  IN DUB FT PARLY B & GARDNA
JINX IN DUB
description: Bristol DJ and producer widely regarded as one of the top dubwise breaks producer and no mean DJ too.

title: JJ ROSA
description: musically explosive, vocally dynamic, sex-groove sleaze-blues rock 'n' roll force of nature known as JJ Rosa.

title: JOANNA WANG
description: Taiwanese singer songwriter on the margins of twee pop and electronic soul - so kitsch it hurts.

title: JOHN GRANT
description: The magnificent John Grant has made swearing in songs almost essential, a maverick songwriter whose vocal is simply breathtaking and whose lyrical content is once funny and alarming. He is the GMF!

title: JOHN ILLSLEY (DIRE STRAITS) & BAND
description: The original Dire Straits bass player still retains that lightness of touch that provided the backbone of their earlier rootsy ballads, and his latest album, ‘Testing The Water’ strikes the same vein with a hint of Celtic soul for good measure.

title: JOHN NEWMAN
description: Not the cardinal from the 1800s, but a new soul voice that’s deep and emotional, like he just stepped off the train from Detroit in the ‘70s with lush swoops of sound and some supercool falsetto breaks. Pukka haircut too!

title: JOHN OTWAY PRESENTS, ROCK N ROLL'S GREATEST FALIURE – OTWAY THE MOVIE
JOHN STAPLETON
description: Playing breakbeat, jungle, hip-hop, French house, old reggae, and, most intriguingly, his soul version of The Beatles' ‘Dear Prudence’.

title: JOHN WIZARDS
description: Otherworldly hallucinogenic and breathtakingly fresh, John Wizards remain hard to categorise. A young white Cape Town advertising jingle writer and a Namibian refugee singer, pure magic.

title: JOHNNY FLYNN & THE SUSSEX WIT
description: An acclaimed actor who has appeared at the Royal Court Theatre, no less, and a Communion contemporary of Mumford & Sons and Laura Marling, with an eclectic take of roots music that spreads as wide as Hank Williams and Peruvian Chica.

title: JON BONGLY - SOUL AND DJANGO REMIX
JON HOPKINS LIVE
description: London-based producer  musician and 2013 Mercury Prize winner. Beneath a cinema screen of magnified dyes crystallising, it's all part of Hopkins' stated aim to hypnotise and overwhelm with sound

title: JON LANGFORD
description: A former regular touring partner of Mr Bragg, now resident in Chicago, the one-time Mekon and Three Johns axis plays with his Welsh henchmen The Men Of Gwent.

title: JONATHAN CAINER – WHAT’S THE POINT IN BEING YOU?
JONNY LANG
description: At 13, Lang’s voice was compared to a 40-year old blues veteran, now 20 years later his blues, gospel and rock mix has elevated him to Award winning status. A seasoned guitarist, he’s championed by Clapton, the Stones and a host of others.

title: JOSH RECORD
description: Ahead of the release of his debut album, Josh returns to WGS on the back of his glorious ‘For Your Love’. If the sun is shining, it will be time for the first Mojito of the day (NB: other drinks are good too).

title: JOURNALISE DORIAN LYNSKEY IN CONVERSATION WITH THE BEAUTIFUL SOUTH'S PAUL HEATON (ON MUSIC AND POLITICS)
JUANA MOLINA
description:
Former comedian turned Singer/Songwriter from Argentina, whose latest album, 'WED 21', uses
loops, layered vocals and electronic beats to create an experimental and playful sound all of her own.

title: JULIEN TEMPLE'S RIO 50˚ - CARRY ON CARIOCA
description: Julien Temple's incisive take on the streets of Rio

title: JUNGLE
description: Centered around the mysterious J and T, Jungle play old school soul music, with a hint of Curtis Mayfield, a smattering of Aloe Blacc, a whisper of Marvin and an infectious line in melody topped by a glorious falsetto.

title: JURASSIC 5
description: Reunited in 2013 after a six-year hiatus, the full crew, including Charlie 2na and Cut Chemist, rekindle their much-praised ‘90s alternative hip-hop.

title: JUS NOW LIVE
description: Fast paced double speak from this electric reggae duo from Bristol and Trinidad who reset the boundaries of traditional Caribbean music. It’s party stuff with a big, big sound and a final chance to lose those inhibitions before work tomorrow.

title: JUST DO IT, A TALE OF MODERN DAY OUTLAWS – FILM
JUST EDIBLE : THE EEL EATS EVERYTHING & LUCAS
JUST EDIBLE : TOM RIO & DAN WILD
KACEY MUSGRAVES
description: Straight talking or some might say outspoken country singer whose ‘Same Trailer Different Park’ album took her from her independent roots to last year’s Grammy Awards, an overnight success that actually began with her debut album back in 2002.

title: KAGOULE
description: One for the new batch of UK noise bands, a touch of grunge, some metal moments and plenty of quiet bits to accentuate the monster riffs. Nice one.

title: KAISER CHIEFS
description: With album number four in the bag and Ricky a household name through has Will-I-Am taunting on The Voice, the Kaisers end the day with riots predicted and classy new tunes like ‘Bows And Arrows’, all leading to the inevitable campsite singalong of Ruby, Ruby, Ruby’ late into the night.

title: KASABIAN
description: Kasabian have always been jokey wags with a rock leaning and dance sensibilities pulsing through their songs. The new album ’48.13’ sounds like Happy Mondays doing Kraftwerk but speeded up. It’s fist in the air and a pretty good way to end this glorious weekend. You gotta love Serge’s beard too.

title: KATE TEMPEST
description: Much talked about poetess and spoken word specialist whose street-friendly style began when she rapped at unsuspecting coves on the night bus. Look out!

title: KELIS
description: Having hit big some time ago in 2003 with the Pharrell-penned ‘Milkshake’, Kelis has reached album number six and returned to a more horn-driven R&B sound that sits comfortably behind her distinctly soulful vocals.

title: KIDNAP KID
description: Kidnap Kid made his name with a string of successful singles, with debut ‘Vehl‘ on Black Butter going on to receive the accolade of US iTunes ‘Best Electronic Song of 2012‘.

title: KIESZA
description: With a number one single in the UK with ‘Hideaway’ this hugely talented singer/songwriter will be serving up a pop version of house with lots of oohs and aaahs.

title: KILLAMONJAMBO
description: Headstrong rootsy reggae sounds.

title: KILLERWATTS
description: Tristan and Avalon the two heavyweight Nano trance masters combine forces and become Killerwatts

title: KING CHARLES
description: A former sparring partner of the Mumfords, Marling and Noah And The Whale, King Charles is a clever songwriter who brings together the rudiments of traditional folk sounds from all over the world and makes the individual elements into pristine modern sketches that sound pretty damn timeless. How does he do that?

title: KIZZY CRAWFORD
description: A Welsh speaking - and indeed singing - Bajan descendant playing a weird hybrid of world music that revolves around driving rhythms and her engaging ethereal vocal.

title: KNOW ABOUT GENETIC MODIFICATION - GERALD MILES, ORGANIC FARMER
KODALINE
description: Sadly it will be too light to get the old school lighters or wax flares out as you marvel at the emotional turmoil of their excellent ‘High Hopes’, but arm waving and emotional angst will suffice for this anthem-strewn Dublin quartet.

title: KOVE
description: More soulful downtempo drum and bass sounds from the man who mixed up ‘Iodine’ and has a hankering for the echo switch.

title: KUBICLE AFTER PARTY WITH TBA GUESTS
KWABS
description: Once compared in the Guardian as “Stevie Wonder jamming with The Human League” and “the new Seal.” Expect high quality vocal dexterity.

title: KÖLSCH
description: Bringing melody back into techno, the half Irish, half Danish DJ and producer was championed by Pete Tong earlier this year as a one to watch for the future.

title: LADI6
description: Of Samoan descent, this New Zealand-born singer mixes elements of reggae and hip hop to create a strange hybrid rhythm that percolates behind her earthy vocal.

title: LADY LYKEZ
description: Breathless, rapid tongue twisting raps and fast talking tales of everyday life, with the inevitable mention of her collection of bras.

title: LAID BLAK SOUNDSYSTEM
description: More sound system action from this more relaxed but no less loud crew.

title: LANA DEL REY
description: Most recently in the studio with Black Keys’ mainman Dan Auerbach and having also written with Rufus Wainwright, expectation is high for Lana Del Rey’s new album, the first single from which suggested a darker and far more mysterious sound behind her ethereal vocal.

title: LAPSLEY
description: Holly 'Låpsley' Fletcher makes minimal yet striking electronic music with achingly beautiful vocals, the kind of sound you want to hear before you slip into oblivion.

title: LARKIN POE
description: Multi-instrumentalist sisters often compared to The Dixie Chicks mixing folk-rock and old school Americana all served up with captivating harmonies.

title: LAU
description: Fiddles! Accordions! They’re all here, what better way to soothe the Saturday hangover than to listen to this Scottish trio and their traditional folk songs?

title: LAZY HABITS
description: Inner city rap with beats and brass adding to the general melee

title: LEGALISATION OF CANNABIS - GREEN PARTY DRUGS GROUP
LEWAH
description: LEWAH covers bass music with her rolling ‘Chillstep’ DJ style through to bass heavy and nu-jungle sets

title: LIE BACK AND THINK OF ENGLAND
LILY ALLEN
description: The fast-talking and sassy singer returns on the back of a brand new album with yet more well observed and beautifully crafted odes to modern life. Oh My God, I can’t believe it.

title: LITTLE DRAGON
description: Previous Gorillaz collaborators, Little Dragon have forged their own unique path over the past seven years and four albums. Yukimi Nagano is central to their expressive sound, her throaty and strangely deep soulful vocal tripping lightly over simple beats or pulsing synth melodies.

title: LITTLE DRAGON (DJ SET)
description: With elements of trip hop, dreamy neo soul and a smattering of plugged-in electronica, expect a heady late night performance from the SBTRKT and Gorrilaz collaborators.

title: LITTLE SIMZ
description: Jay Z and Huw Stephens supported UK rapper and occasional actress from downtown Islington.

title: LIZZO
description: The Guardian says: “Think Salt-n-Pepa and Queen Latifah for some idea of the comically frank and feisty lyrics and the dexterously deployed snippets and samples.”

title: LOCO DICE
description: Dusseldorf’s king of techno and electronic music started out in hip hop but soon became transfixed by the rhythm into which he drops film dialogue and all kinds of bleeps and electronic notation.

title: LONDON GRAMMAR
description: Oh yes, this has got to be the mobile in the air moment of the weekend. London Grammar’s slow trip hop imbibed ballads and Hannah Reid’s rich evocative vocals set against melody lines that are quasi classical in their construction. Hope you’ve got battery left.

title: LONELY THE BRAVE
description: Big guitars! Imagine a jam session with Biffy Clyro and The Edge fleshing it out on the effects pedal. Big melodic lines, chiming reverb, a few tattoos and – if warm – one of them will take their shirt off (not The Edge though).

title: LOST MAP PRESENTS PICTISH TRAIL AND TUFF LOVE
description: Direct from the Island of Eigg, Johnny Lynch’s label showcases the off kilter Pictish Trail and the exuberant youth of Tuff Love. Fort folk’s sake.

title: LOUISE WILLIAMS, JOHN SAUVEN & SOPHIA HENRI – THE ENERGY DEBATE
LUCKYBUS SOUND SYSTEM & SPECIAL GUESTS INCL LOCO MOTION & NICK THE MARTIAN CLOSING DANCE PARTY
LUCY ROSE
description: After the punk thrash of The Subways and before the electronic hues of White Lies, a rose between two thorns (geddit?), the delicate soul searching of singer songwriter and elegiac poetess Lucy Rose.

title: LUKE SITAL-SINGH
description: Bristol’s very own Bon Iver with a subtle and underplayed delivery and some gorgeous songs too.

title: LXURY
description: One man and his misspelt name on the wheels of steel.

title: LYKKE LI
description: The melancholy mood continues with Lykke Li’s meditative and contemplative observations. Her new album, ‘I Never Learn’ delves deeply and personally into the “hurt and pride and confusion of being a woman”. Deep but never short of devastatingly delivered.

title: LYLA FOY
description: Disturbingly haunting with Kate Bushery in reserve, Lyla Foy is a singer/songwriter from London signed to Seattle’s Sub Pop, playing emotional show and tell stories that linger long after.

title: M+A
description: The outright winners of the Glastonbury Emerging Talent Competition, M+A purvey powerful percussive pop-dance sounds.

title: MACHINEDRUM LIVE
description: This multi-instrumentalist rewards the careful listener subtle tempo shifts and unexpected sounds that make him an artist in his own right.

title: MAD DOG MCREA
description: Penny whistle powered jiggery folkery with a top hat to boot.

title: MAD PROFESSOR FT GENERAL LEVY & JOE ARIWA
description: Ariwa sounds is the home of Mad Professor, Joe Ariwa and various other multi-talented musicians. Ariwa focuses their energy on providing dub/dubstep/reggae/roots on a positive level.

title: MADAME BARDUCCI AND THE GOUDZY GUITAR
MANIC STREET PREACHERS
description: You’ve got to love the Manics. Nicky Wire reckons they should build a motorway through Glastonbury and, yes, that would be handy. Expect the hits - ‘Motorcycle Emptiness’, ‘You Stole The Sun From My Heart’, ‘A Design For Life’, ‘If You Tolerate This…’ And some new stuff!  Perfect!

title: MARC JB
description: Future disco or “music for sexy people” as the man himself puts it.

title: MARC JB
description: Future disco or “music for sexy people” as the man himself puts it.

title: MARIKA HACKMAN
description: Hailed as the new voice of British post-folk and one to watch by MOJO Magazine, or “the lovechild of Nico and Joanna Newsome” according to NYLON magazine.

title: MARMOZETS
description: Hotly tipped in the States, this UK outfit embrace short sharp punk next to more complex prog rock epics, like an angry Paramore with the impressively angsty Becca on vocals.

title: MASSIVE ATTACK
description: It wouldn’t be Glastonbury Festival without these Bristolian strollers. The trip hop legends whose wafting electronic soul music and a cornucopia of guest vocalists have ensured that their tenure at the top continues unabated. Always a classic.

title: MATRIX & FUTUREBOUND
description: With three chart-topping hits over the past three years, the drum and bass groove revs up with the duo who are accompanied by MC Rhymemaster.

title: MAXI PRIEST
description: Hailing from the UK Saxon Sound System, Maxi Priest has charted consistently (‘Close To You’, ‘Easy To Love’) since the early ‘90s with his smooth brand of lovers rock.

title: MAYA JANE COLES
description: Moving on with deep house, electronic and maybe even a touch of dubstep and a little bit of electronic dub from this versatile producer and DJ.

title: MAYITO RIVERA & THE SONS OF CUBA
MELBOURNE SKA ORCHESTRA
description: A mammoth 30-piece Australian orchestra bringing a modern take on ska in a big band setting, like Madness doing the Proms. A frenzy of pork pie hats!

title: MELLA DEE
description: Spinning sounds that mix garage, hip-hop and house under the darker shroud of UK funky and dubstep.

title: MELT YOURSELF DOWN
description: The Guardian described the band (who feature Pete Wareham (Acoustic Ladyland, Polar Bear) and Shabaka Hutchings (Sons of Kemet, the Heliocentrics) as being “heavy on Afrocentric jazz-tinged tribal pop with avant-garde tendencies and no little funk”.  Can’t argue with that.

title: MERRY MCLOUD
description: Great Band. Merry is an accomplished vocal talent with a sprinkle of Celtic magic.

title: METALLICA
description: One of the original from the “big four” of thrash metal, who honed their mighty riffs on 1991’s ‘Metallica’, an album that made them one of the biggest selling acts in the world. Expect monster chugging metal powered by Lars Ulrich’s frenetic drumming. Guaranteed: None more black!

title: METRONOMY
description: With their most complete and commercially successful album yet, ‘Love Letters’, the Metronomy experience has evolved into a truly uplifting slice of electronic oddness that bears all the hallmarks of sunshine pop of the ‘60s but remains decidedly modern at the same time.

title: MGMT
description: MGMT’s original success with ‘Oracular Spectacular’ only hinted at what was to come. Most recently described as “weird”, but “in a good way”, their blend of old school psychedelic sounds and garage rock submerged in new fangled synth sounds makes for an off kilter pop sound that’s, er, weird but in a good way.

title: MIA
description: Combining cutting edge beats, revolutionary politics and a hyper-real day-glo sensibility, MIA was rated as one of the world's most influential people in 2009 by Time magazine. Subsequently lauded by Madonna and caught being “controversial” at The Superbowl, her infectious rhythmic sounds and larger than life stage presence are essential viewing.

title: MICHAEL CAMPARI AND THE SOLAR SYSTEM
MICHAEL CAMPARI AND THE SOLAR SYSTEM
MICHAEL CAMPARI AND THE SOLAR SYSTEM
MICHAEL KIWANUKA
description: Just ahead of the release of his second album, the much touted singer songwriter upgrades his folky take on cool soul, letting his dreamy vocal carry the groove.

title: MIDLAKE
description: Can’t understand how their breathtaking Americana gem ‘The Trials Of Van Occupanther’ never made them national treasures here or back home in Texas. Two albums later and they continue to amaze, like a prog Grateful Dead – what a concept.

title: MIDLAKE: LIVE IN DENTON, TX
description: Americana alert! The UK premiere of the movie that captures the mighty Midlake, who play live on the Other Stage on Saturday, in Texas.

title: MISTA SAVONA
description: One of Australia’s leading reggae and dancehall producers whose live show features a variety of guest vocalists.

title: MNEK
description: 19-year-old Nigerian born singer/songwriter with a dance pop, R&B, house and UK garage mix whose also found time to work with everyone from Little Mix and Tinie Tempeh to Clean Bandit and Rudimental.

title: MO'KALAMITY
description: Cape Verde born singer who grew up in France and has developed a reputation for militant lyrics and driving reggae rhythms.

title: MOGWAI
description: The post rock tag is pretty limitless, allowing these long time Scottish sound experimenters to dabble in all kinds of genres as they build their esoteric soundtrack into an epic and all engaging sonic adventure of the greatest kind.

title: MOLLY
description: Straight from the Eurovision Song Contest and not a sign of a beard hair.

title: MONEY FOR ROPE
description: More from down under, Money For Rope are from Melbourne and know when a chiming guitar is needed. With two drummers and a splurge of keyboards they’re that kind of chunky good time bar room band that make sense of pre-lunch cocktails.

title: MONKEY PILOT (WHIRL-Y-GIG)
description: Whirl-y-Gif embodies the spirit of community in a carnival atmosphere.

title: MORNING SERVICE WITH ECKLECTIC MICK'S GOSPEL REMIX
MOYA BRENNEN
description: The Clannad vocalist with friends and family revisiting her Celtic past.

title: MR YIPADEE & THE BEAR-Y GOOD BAND
MR.B
description: Bringing pipe-smoking Chap Hop to the masses – bring your ‘tache and chin stroke.

title: MS. DYNAMITE
description: The performer formerly known as Ms Dy-Na-Mi-Tee takes to the decks for a mix of hip hop, R&B, two step and all points between.

title: MUNGO'S HIFI
description: It’s still a shop, a sound system, a label – and their crew will be playing new reggae and classic roots music for this Saturday night set.

title: MUNGO'S HIFI
description: It’s all back to the shop tomorrow – but first of all a last set of new reggae and classic roots music.

title: MUNGO'S HIFI.
description: It’s a shop, a sound system, a label – spinning pioneering new reggae and classic roots music.

title: MUSICAL BINGO
description: Eyes down, DJs on, it’s the start of the annual William’s Green launch party with spot prizes too!

title: MY NU LENG
description: Black Butter dup who add a touch of classical nuance to their mixes.

title: MYRON & E
description: Former Blackalicious backing singers who’ve debuted with their own ‘Broadway’ album on Stones Throw. A smooth soul throwback to the heydays of the ‘70s brought bang up to date.

title: MØ
description: Spiky electro pop from Karen Marie Orsted, filled with some soulful vibes and all topped with poni-tail that defies gravity.

title: N'TOKO
description: Slovenian rapper brings his sometimes chunky and often brooding hip-hop to town for a pre-festival early evening drive-by.

title: NEW BUILD
description: Featuring Hot Chip and LCD Sound System veterans with a minimal techno hue shading their vocal-led tunes.

title: NEW MOON CACAO CEREMONY WITH REBEKAH SHAMAN
NEWTON FAULKNER
description: A master of fleet fingered acoustic guitar and feel good, easy going tunes, the dreadlocked dreamer returns to Avalon with a new album and some old faves in his biodegradable carrier bag.

title: NGAIIRE
description: An impressive vocalist with an infectious delivery that hints of jazz, deep soul and the weird hybrid that is future folk.

title: NICK LOWE
description: An Acoustic Stage staple, guaranteed to make grown men cry with his stories of heartache and lost love standing proudly next to his well recognised anthems. What’s So Funny ‘bout ‘P,L&U’ is essential Glastonbury.

title: NICK MULVEY
description: An ex-member of Mercury-nominated The Portico Quartet who studied music and art in Cuba before developing an interest in African sounds, Mulvey allows all previous events to bubble beneath the surface of his gripping alternative folk.

title: NICK MULVEY
description: Straight from a Pyramid slot, Nick Mulvey brings his troubadour folk to the more intimate WG setting, close enough to touch, near enough to hear the subtleties of his storytelling.

title: NICK PARKER AND THE FALSE ALARMS
NICKY BOMBA'S BUSTAMENTO
description: An Australian six-piece playing rock steady ska with steel pans and honking saxophones adding momentum to their rootsy tongue-in-cheek humour.

title: NINA NESBITT
description: Following her big hit ‘Stay Out’ and her debut album ‘Peroxide’ the singer songwriter from Edinburgh brings her sing-along strumming to the Parlure.

title: NINA PERSSON
description: The former lead singer of The Cardigans and an occasional sparring partner for the Manics, Nina Persson’s ‘Animal Heart’ album from earlier this year was dipped in all the right kinds of synth melancholy.

title: NITIN SAWHNEY
description: What better way to sink into Saturday than with the spiritual sounds of Nitin Sawhney? Whether he’s wrapped up in trip hop, working with an orchestra or veering between jazz and drum and bass, his cultural roots and political beliefs exude enthusiasm.

title: NORTH MISSISSIPPI ALLSTARS
description: Hill-country blues brought bang up to date by this Grammy winning band, who are taking time off from supporting Robert Plant.

title: NUMBERS BOAT PARTY PRESENTS JACKMASTER, OPTIMO AND SPENCER
description: The website, club night and label brings Jackmaster, Optimo and Spencer for a four hour afternoon session. Life jackets not required.

title: OBSERVER JOURNALIST LUCY SIEGLE IN CONVERSATION WITH GREENPEACE DIRECTER JOHN SAUVEN ABOUT GREENPEACE'S INCREDIBLE YEAR
OLIVER BROAD THE PRINCESS AND THE FROG
OLIVER BROAD THE PRINCESS AND THE FROG
ONE BOMB
description: Rampaging electronic dance duo with double speed raps and a pulsing sound now assisted by a conga player and some additional bleeping electronic muscle.

title: OPEN MIC (HOSTED BY STEPHEN JAMES SMITH)
OPENING TRIBUTE TO TONY BENN BY MICHAEL EAVIS
OSSIE
description: Master of the shuffling house groove and prone to drop in some heavy synth lines, the ever-busy Ossie’s most recent tune ‘Heartbeating’ was a peach.

title: PANEL: BEYOND TUITION FEES - WHAT'S NEXT FOR THE STUDENT MOVEMENT WITH PARIS LEES
PANEL: THE POLITICS OF FOODBANKS WITH JACK MONROE
PANEL: THE REVOLUTION WILL BE FEMINISED WITH NIMCO ALI
PANEL: TOWARDS THE NEXT ELECTION WITH KEN LIVINGSTONE
PANEL: WHAT'S LEFT? WITH FRANCESCA MARTINEZ
PAOLO NUTINI
description: After the Van Morrison-styled carnie irreverence of previous Glastonbury shows, the still scarily young Nutini has made his strongest album yet in ‘Caustic Love’ from which the spine tingling ‘Iron Sky’ stands as one of the songs of the year so far, his cracked vocal having never sounded so bittersweet. Warning: May still do King Louie’s ‘King Of The Swingers’ to break the mood.

title: PAQUA
description: Intense looped guitars, funky bass and a jazz funk vibe that verges on the Balearic at times.

title: PARIS-TEXAS AND THE UKE (JERRY HALL AND JEANNE MARINE)
PAROV STELAR BAND
description: We’ve done Belgium, Norway (Bernhoft), Columbia, Argentina, where next? Austria! Parov Stelar’s chosen tools are old school swing music mixed with electro beats. With more than a few jazz horns on play the mix is frenetic and all consuming.

title: PARQUET COURTS
description: Wild and irreverent Brooklyn rock that’s a strange hybrid of punk and modern indie pop with a wry sense of humour and some fulfilling rants on society into the bargain.

title: PAUL HEATON & JACQUI ABBOTT
description: With a more mature worldview on their recent ‘What Have We Become’ album, two of the original singers from The Beautiful South return for a set spiced with new and old material.

title: PEATBOG FAERIES
description: One of Scotland’s leading traditional bands that have won multiple awards for their live shows and their stylish blend of pipes, fiddles and Celtic dance music.

title: PENTATRONIX FT SABAR SOUNDSYSTEM AND SI TREW
PEOPLES STRING FOUNDATION
description: Fiddle-propelled jug band music

title: PHOSPHORESCENT
description: An American singer/songwriter who’s grown into a truly life-affirming composer with his seventh album ‘Muchacho’. A melancholy and introspective journeyman whose heart is right there on his modern Americana sleeve.

title: PIXIES
description: Now slimmed to a trio but still sounding reverb-heavy as the guitars chime and the rhythm chugs like all good Pixies’ songs should do. A smattering of their classics and the kings of American indie in a post grunge kind of way won’t be able to do wrong. Gigantic!?!

title: PLAYGROUND THEATRE CO. & TUCKED IN THEATRE PRESENT BILLY’S BIRTHDAY BASH
POLICA
description: Channey Leanagh’s vocal is soulful, affected, off kilter and beautiful. It’s a new kind of soul music set against the dreamy synthpop of her compadres. Exquisite.

title: POLIÇA
description: Hypnotic dream pop with treated vocals and slow motion rhythms that envelop the senses. Channy Leaneagh’s voice is the key that unlocks their electronic soundtracks, an enticing and purely sensual delivery that goes for the goosebump.

title: POLLY MONEY
description: Her voice is sun-kissed and melodious, her music upbeat – pop with a capital P and her tender years belie a simple new folk charm.

title: PORKY THE POET AKA PHILL JUPITUS
PORT ISLA
description: Hard strumming folky sounds mixed with good time indie pop in sight of some well-thrashed guitars. “Quirky” is the word that comes to mind.

title: PRETTY LIGHTS
description: Since he played the Glade back in 2011 Pretty Lights turned heads new and old with the release of his Grammy nominated A Color Map Of the Sun album last year that incorporated the revolutionary production method of recording to vinyl then sampling his own vinyl to create each track.top of the range with amazing light show. Were lucky to have him back.

title: PSYCHEMAGIK
description: Masters of the transcendent mix tape, dabbling in high grade psycehdelic elctronica.

title: PUBLIC SERVICE BROADCASTING
description: Featuring J Willgoose, Esq and Wrigglesworth who sample old public information films and set them to music to create a surreal newsreel experience. Theremins are wafted, guitars are bashed and banjos are furiously plucked as the past is brought sharply into focus.

title: RADIOPHONIC WORKSHOP
description: Founded in 1958 by Desmond Briscoe and Daphne Oram, the BBC Radiophonic Workshop was home to a maverick group of experimental composers and musical innovators. In a series of small studios within the labyrinthine corridors of the BBC Maida Vale complex, the Workshop explored new ways of using - and abusing - sound technology.

title: RAINY BOY SLEEP
description: There’s a strange innocence to Rainy Boy Sleep, he’s like Jake Bugg’s innocent brother who only comes out of his shell when he straps on a guitar, his sweet voice and natural Irish brogue adding spin to his songs about shopping centres.

title: RALEIGH RITCHIE
description: Mellow Bristolian soul man with some big beaty production values who occasionally turns up in Game Of Thrones as Grey Worm.

title: RALFE BAND
description: Disgruntled folk and off beam introspection from these Boosh soundtracking experimentalists.

title: REBUILD (A GUY CALLED GERALD / GRAHAM MASSY 808 STATE)
RECLAIM OUR ENERGY FUTURE - THEO SIMON, STOP HINKLEY
REDLIGHT
description: Another Bristol export, a producer and remixer (Rudimental, Rihanna, Cee Lo Green, Toddla T) who straddles dancehall, grime, garage, UK funky and drum and bass.

title: REIGNWOLF
description: According to Rolling Stone – and who are we to argue – Reignwolf “sounds like an unhinged, lovelorn, electric Canadian blues wildman who can't decide if he wants to be Robert Plant or Jimmy Page.” Percy or The Dark Lord? What a choice.

title: RICHIE HAWTIN
description: The champion of minimal techno, Richie Hawtin was instrumental in the development of the second wave of Detroit techno in the ‘90s and continues to experiment in the genre.

title: RICHIE RUNDLES PLAYING BACK TO BACK WITH DJ LOUIE LOUIE
RICHY AHMED
description: Specialising in the re-arrangement of house (now there’s a Channel 4 programme asking to be made) by adding disco, funk, techno and hip hop into the mix.

title: RIMSKI'S PIANO
description: The most bizzare, yet amazing street performer you will ever see in the united kingdom! Rimski is a busker who rides a piano bicycle that he built himself. If you enjoyed this video, Subscribe and 'Like' it!
