title: ROB DA BANK + TAYO PRESENT PURPLE RAVE (PRINCE TRIBUTE)
ROBBO RANX PRESENTS 'THIS IS DANCEHALL' FEATURING WAYNE MARSHALL AND GUESTS
description: Robbo Ranx Presents ‘This Is Dancehall’ with Wayne Marshall And Special Guests DJ/LIVE. The Sony award winning 1Xtra reggae and dancehall DJ whose radio show Dancehall Splurt was one of the BBC’s highest rating shows ever presents a three hour sessions featuring Wayne Marshall, a collaborator and contemporary of Sean Paul, and many more..

title: ROBERT PLANT
description: Super eclectic as ever, the Led Zeppelin singer performs with his band The Sensational Space Shifters, dipping into the Zep bag, adding a few blues standards and a song or two from his time with Alison Krause. He’s got a whole lotta love.

title: RODRIGO Y GABRIELA
description: To Mexico with these flamenco rumba specialists/virtuoso acoustic guitarists. With a penchant for covering Metallica and Led Zep, RyG have also performed with Cuban orchestras and most recently did an album dedicated to nine dead cultural icons. Heavy.

title:
RONI SIZE
DJ SET FEAT DYNAMITE MC
ROOTS REGGAE UNDERGROUND HOSTED BY MC CHICKABOO (SOUL II SOUL)
ROUTE 94
description: Having dabbled in dubstep as Dream, Rowan Jones has moved into the world of deep house, hitting big with ‘My Love’ featuring Jess Glynne most recently.

title: ROYAL BLOOD
description: Fuzzy blues rock with a nod to The Black Keys and The White Stripes from this grungey duo whose debut album is released at the end of August.

title: RSVP
description: RSVP Bhangra - the UK's number one festival bhangra band!

title: RUDIMENTAL
description: Following the groundbreaking album ‘Home’ and a host of award nominations, Rudimental follow a gaggle of small shows around site last year with a Pyramid debut. Expect guest vocalists and an uplifting set of anthems. No pressure then, lads

title: RUSTY SHACKLE
description: Alternative folk and bluesy Americana with a nod to The Pogues from this violin-toting Welsh outfit.

title: SAM SMITH
description: The singer of choice for Disclosure and Naughty Boy with more than hit or two of his own up his soulful sleeve – his ‘Money On My Mind’ charted at number one earlier this year - and, fact fans, a third cousin to Lily Allen – Sundays round there place must be mental.

title: SASHA
description: DJ/producer/remixer SASHA is recognized as one of the worlds’ most innovative icons of the electronic genre.

title: SAZ
description: The Palestinian rapper and beatboxer whose socially aware commentaries are delivered in Hebrew and English.

title: SAZ
description: From the Palistinian city of Ramle SAZ rhymes in Arabic, Hebrew and English and is widely hailed for his beat-box technique.

title: SEAN ROWLEY'S GUILTY PLEASURES FEATURING THE OL' DIRTY BRASSTARDS
description: The rub of brass and tweed as The Ol’ DBs play Beyonce and Daft Punk before Mr Rowley spins all the hits you shouldn’t love.

title: SEANI B, TODDLA T & ROBBO RANX
SEUN KUTI & EGYPT 80
description: Fela Kuti’s youngest son inherited the extraordinary Egypt 80 Orchestra in 1997 when his father died. His latest album, ‘A Long Way To The Beginning’, is his tightest and most electrifying yet, still brimming with righteous anger, pushing Afrobeat forward in a way not seen since Fela’s heyday.

title: SHAAI'R + FUNC
description: An American singer and actress forms half of this alternative electronic duo with roots in Mumbai.

title: SHADOW CHILD
description: Award winning (iTunes US Best Electronic Song of 2012 for ‘Vehl’) DJ whose house, garage and electronic mix has a strange otherworldly sound to it.

title: SHANTY
description: London-based party reggae crew.

title: SHIT ROBOT
description: Electronic dance sounds from the Robot whose latest album features the monster track ‘Do That Dance’ featuring LCD Soundsystem’s Nancy Whang.

title: SHOWHAWK DUO
description: Virtuoso guitar duo with an eclectic taste that straddles Ibiza faves and ‘Bohemian Rhapsody’.

title: SHY FX AND STAMINA MC
description: A stalwart of the drum and bass and jungle scenes with his roots in reggae, Shy FX has remixed everyone from Plan B to Dizzee to Emeli Sande as well as having hits in his own right on his own Digital Soundboy label.

title: SIGMA
description: The drum and bass duo of Cameron Edwards and Joe Lenzie increase the dancefloor frenzy.

title: SIMIAN FRENZY
description: Bass Music for the Dance floor and beyond! Playing live with proper songs, sweet vocals large beats, and heavy bass!

title: SKINNY LISTER
description: Not your average folk band, “more like an English Pogues but with better teeth,” according to one waggish journalist. Expect bar room folk and good time sing-along tunes.

title: SKIP&DIE
description: Having taken a multi-cultural journey across South Africa, S&D now exude tropical, hip-hop, electronica and a host of otherworldly influences.

title: SKRILLEX
description: Manhandling the basic runes of dubstep, electro house and post hardcore, Skrillex has become the man at the mixer for many, his production skills reshaping the sonic soundscape in the US and UK. He played a secret show in Silver Hayes last year and closes Friday with a bang! What a haircut too!

title: SLAM (HOSTED BY MARCUS MOORE AND SARA-JANE ARBURY)
SLIPMATT, BILLY DANIEL BUNTER, RATPACK & THE RAGGA TWINS
SMOKE FAIRIES
description: Further into the realms of folk rock with a psyche hue, some thudding drums and some exotic harmonies. Imagine if Jesus And Mary Chain were girls on downers with no key to the electric guitar cupboard.

title: SNAKEHIPS
description: Renowned production duo whose deeply soulful ‘On And On’ became a huge dancefloor smash last year.

title: SOAK
description: A vivid portrait of teenage deep-thinking: intricate, ambiguous psychodramas! The Guardian reckoned of this 17-year-old singer/songwriter.

title: SON OF DAVE
description: Intense solo bluesman double tracking harp and vocals for maximum grooves

title: SON OF KICK
description: SON OF KICK London-based bass magician Son Of Kick has developed a distinctive reputation in both his audio and visual work.

title: SOOTHSAYERS
description: One of the finest slices of a Anglo Carribean fusion since The Specials in their prime, artfully mixing in funk and Afrobeat to their deep dub. Uncut magazine

title: SOPHIE ELLIS-BEXTOR
description: The Strictly favourite followed her dance exploits with a return to singer songwriting on her ‘Wanderlust’ album, a thoughtful slice of full blown pop was the result. Add a bit of ‘Murder On The Dancefloor’ and this is set to be a classic night.

title: SPECTOR
description: Heroic bravado and swaggering chords vibrate from the very heart of Spector, a brash and effervescent nonchalance that makes them absolutely irresistible.

title: SPEECH DEBELLE
description: Mercury prize winner, top notch chef and curator of ‘The Strength And Vulnerability Bunker’ art exhibition at the South Bank (look it up when you get home), the UK rapper remains a socially aware spokesperson for her generation.

title: ST. VINCENT
description: Her pedigree is exemplary, a former member of The Polyphonic Spree, who’s performed with both Sufjan Stevens and David Byrne, Annie Clark is a multi-instrumentalist and singer songwriter who sounds like she could soundtrack any of David Lynch’s movies at the drop of a plectrum.

title: STANTON WARRIORS
description: Stanton Warriors: back by popular demand. Original west country duo Internationally renowned. The best dancing crowd of 2013 Spirit of '71 stage..

title: STEVE HILLAGE FUSES GONG AND SYSTEM 7
description: Steve Hillage invites current GONG musicians to guest with him and partner Miquette Giraudy to create a rocking techno fusion System 7 set.

title: STRINGERBESSANT
description: It’s those two blokes from Reef in their brand new band, piano and acoustics rattle and some groggy vocals give it that downhome bluesy back porch feel. West country and western.

title: STROMAE
description: A Belgian singer with more than a hint of an African guitar, an electronic melody line and a mix of sounds that move from ballad to rap. More from the backpack of Manu Chao on what’s a truly international groove.

title: STURGILL SIMPSON
description: Originally compared to Waylon Jennings and Merle Haggard, Sturgill Simpson remains firmly in good country company on his latest album ‘Metamodern Sounds In Country Music’.

title: SULTAN OF THE DISCO
description: A virtual supergroup from the Korean Boonga Boonga Record label with high-end production values and plenty of tongue-in-cheek theatrics over a sound that’s filled with Eastern promise.

title: SUMMER CAMP
description: If EIY are bittersweet naysayers, Summer Camp couldn’t be any more cheerful as they deliver gorgeous lo-fi indie pop that sounds like it’s plucked from the summer of love circa ’66.

title: SUN RA ARKESTRA
description: One of the most influential artists of the 20th century, Sun Ra claimed to be from outer space and played psychedelic jazz before it was invented. He would have been 100 this year and long-time collaborator, saxophonist Marshall Allen, celebrates the fact and continues the legend from way beyond the stars.

title: SUPERFOOD
description: A blue touch paper moment. After the calm – the new wave of British guitar noise sets the afternoon off. OK, so we know they do “mellow”, their version of The Beastie Boys’ ‘Fight For Your Right’ is grand, but plug in and lift off on this one.

title: SUZANNE VEGA
description: With the splendidly titled ‘Tales From The Realm Of The Queen Of Pentacles’ just released – her first album for seven years – Suzanne Vega seems to be on a spiritual high and at the peak of her songwriting powers. A great place to see out the weekend.

title: SWAMP 81 FT LOEFAH, PALEMAN + CHUNKY
description: Three DJs from Loefah’s dubstep-friendly Swamp 81 label (named after the Stop And Search law of 1981 and the subsequent Brixton riots).

title: SWEDISH HOUSE MAFIA - LEAVE THE WORLD BEHIND
SWINDLE (DJ)
description: Inspired by reggae and jazz and more than at home to a cool, laidback groove given half a chance, expect an intriguing mix.

title: TEMPLES
description: Without doubt, their debut album is one of the most stunning and consistent so far this year. Sure there’s more than a nod to ‘60s psychedelia and some gloriously archaic wordplay, but the melodies are simply marvelous.

title: TEMPLES
description: Timeless evocative psyche pop that’s wildly catchy and filled with Byrdsian charm, Zombies-like quirkiness and gorgeous melodies. For all that, it sounds so effortlessly modern. Certainly one of the groups of the weekend. Don’t miss.

title: TERRY HOOLIGAN & RICO TUBBS (BASS=WIN SOUND SYSTEM)’
THE 1975
description: Last year they played at William’s Green, this year they’re opening for Dolly Parton, that’s Glastonbury – and the hit single ‘Chocolate’ (only 13.5 million views on YouTube so far) for you. Don’t be left out - practice the bit where you sing along well in advance.

title: THE BAD SHEPHERDS
description: Punk rock songs with folk musicality and great banter from comedian and sometime chef Ade Edmondson making for a slightly surreal and winning combo.

title: THE BEAT
description: Fronted by Ranking Roger, one of the biggest Two-Tone bands whose anthemic ‘Stand Down Margaret’, ‘Mirror In The Bathroom’ and a skanked up version of ‘Tears Of A Clown’ set a generation dancing at the turn of the ‘80s.

title: THE BEVIS FROND
description: Loved by Dinosaur Jr and Teenage Fanclub, the Frond are a 20 year overnight success, mixing psyche and prog into an evocative and addictive brew. Like The Beatles with two blokes from Hawkwind joining them.

title: THE BLACK KEYS
description: The Keys are at the peak of their powers right now. Producing a herd of like-minded patrons’ albums, adding muscle to their very own sound and playing the kind of simple blues rock that transcends generations and indeed genres. This will be a spectacular show.

title: THE BLACK TAMBOURINES
description: Twisted ‘60s garage rock from this band that look like they’ve just finished their paper round. Anarchic, cheeky and punky to the last, they also won the Glastonbury Emerging Talent Competition.

title: THE BLUES BAND
description: Former Manfreds’ men Paul Jones and Tom McGuinness started this ‘back to their roots’ project back in 1979 in an attempt to earn beer money. That they remain at the bar over 30 years later is testament to their authentic love of the genre and a massive thirst.

title: THE BOHICAS
description: More riffs, more franticness. The Bohicas deliver old school light and dark, heavy and restrained, all done for maximum effect. Glorious, uplifting, tub-thumping and life-affirming, Man, it’s Sunday, we made it!

title: THE BRIAN JONESTOWN MASSACRE
description: The film Dig! was one of the most monumental movies about a dysfunctional band ever. Such things always make BJM gigs much anticipated and, with a back catalogue that runs to 19 albums so far it’s hard to know which wigged out proto psyche pop indie rock hat main man Anton Newcombe will don for the night.

title: THE DAPTONE SUPER SOUL REVUE
description: Featuring Sharon Jones And the Dap-Kings, Charles Bradley And His Extraordinaires, Antibalas and The Sugarman 3 with special guests Saun and Starr and Master of Ceremonies Binky Griptite. A two-hour showcase featuring rolling sets from the best funk and soul acts on the planet assembled by the legendary US record label. Think Motown Soul revue and Stax Showcase for the new millennium.

title: THE DODGE BROS
description: Delivering a film noir take on jug band blues and rockabilly – straight out of a David Lynch dream.

title: THE DUTTY INSPECTORS
description: “Unbelievable dancehall, bashment and soca with a constant party vibe, free and fun loving...

title: THE FOX PROBLEM
description: And, finally, they have their own ludicrous TV show, and now Georgina Lewis Anderson, Radio 1’s Gem Cairney and Georgie Okel take to the decks for the last World Cup-like 90 minutes of William’s Green 2014. What could possibly go wrong?

title: THE GIRL AND THE ROBOTS
description: Not the computer game or that song by Royksopp and Robyn, but some slowly evolving electronic soundscape from this male/female duo.

title: THE GUARDIAN PRESENTS 20 FEET FROMSTARDOM
description: Documentary following the backing singers whose “oohs” and “aahs” usually go unheralded, with cameo appearances from Bowie, Ray Charles and Sheryl Crow among many others.

title: THE HENRY GIRLS
description: A mix of Irish folk and Americana powered by harp and the Henry sisters’ three part harmonies that easily lift them into the world of Gillian Welch and the Indigo Girls.

title: THE HOBBIT: THE DESOLATION OF SMAUG 3D
THE HORRORS
description: Having fashioned future psychedelia and become “more dancey” (NME) in the process, with the odd nod to Simple Minds in their pomp, The Horrors’ fourth album ‘Luminous’ has taken them to dizzy new heights of guitar-fuelled rock.

title: THE HURRIERS
description: Barnsley’s very own “proper Socialist punk rock band” with some jagged Clash and Redskins-inspired political pop tunes.

title: THE INTERNET
description: A soul band formed by producer Matt Martians and lead vocalist Syd “The Kyd” of Odd Future that has resulted in her flexing her writing and vocal skills over two great albums and some universally heralded live shows.

title: THE JEZABELS
description: Two men, two ladies, all the way from Australia, The Jezabels play air punching anthems laced with synth and topped by Hayley Mary’s expressive vocal. It’s time for the final frenzy of Sunday.

title: THE LEE THOMPSON SKA ORCHESTRA
description: Former Madness men Lee Thompson and Mark Bedford introduce a whole new generation to the irresistible rhythms of ‘60s Jamaican music.

title: THE LONDON SINFONIETTA AND SYNERGY VOCALS & JONNY GREENWOOD
description: The orchestra’s self-proclaimed mission is to “place the best contemporary classical music at the heart of today’s culture”. They’ll be fulfilling this by performing two works by composer Steve Reich, ‘Music for 18 Musicians’ and ‘Electric Counterpoint’, for the latter they’ll be joined by Radiohead’s Jonny Greenwood.

title: THE LOW KEYS AND THE WILDER MEN
THE LOW KEYS AND THE WILDER MEN
THE LOW KEYS AND THE WILDER MEN
THE LOW KEYS AND THE WILDER MEN
THE LOW KEYS AND THE WILDER MEN
THE LOW KEYS AND THE WILDER MEN
THE MAN THAT WILL NOT BE BLAMED FOR NOTHING
THE MAN WITH THE MOVIE CAMERA
THE MARIACHIS
description: The band from the Doritos advert that has now clocked up 13.5 million online video views for their covers of popular songs with a Mexican twist.

title: THE MEN THAT WON'T BE BLAMED FOR NOTHING
THE MOLES
description: All the way from Australia, Cardinal’s Richard Davies’ original band reformed for a series of much praised album re-issues, offering baroque pop with a psychedelic colour wash.

title: THE NATIONAL THEATRE PRESENTS DR SEUSS’S CAT IN THE HAT
THE NATIONAL THEATRE PRESENTS DR SEUSS’S CAT IN THE HAT
THE PREATURES
description: More Australians! They’re running the show. There’s some swirling hair going on here, lurking behind the jerky gyrations of Isabella Manfredi – who does a bit of restrained air guitar now and again while the guys strum some substantial riffs.

title: THE RAILS
description: And now, some folk rock courtesy of a duo who include the daughter of Richard and Linda Thompson and a man who’s played guitar with Son Volt and The Pernice Brothers. Cred intact for sure and their songs are stunning.

title: THE RAILS
description: The return of folk rock at the hands of the daughter of Richard And Linda Thompson and a man who’s played guitar for The Pernice Brothers and the much loved Son Volt among many others.

title: THE REVEREND PEYTON'S BIG DAMN BAND
description: The beard sporting Rev plays a mean back porch bottleneck guitar with some heavy foot stomping over a skiffle-styled shuffling beat, a weird cross between The Legendary Stardust Cowboy and Seasick Steve.

title: THE REVEREND PEYTON'S BIG DAMN BAND
description: Peyton, his wife Breezy and Ben “Bird Dog” Bussell hail from southern Indiana and play Delta blues with a hillbilly fervour and musical acuity that’s as sharp as razor wire.

title: THE RIPTIDE MOVEMENT
description: Dublin’s Riptide Movement have been gently simmering since 2006, their pert rock sound constantly hinting at their traditional rolling roots while occasionally breaking into a more gritty mid-Atlantic groove.

title: THE SELECTER
description: Original exponents of Two-Tone’s ska punk social awareness, The Selecter are still fronted by the soulful Pauline Black, the queen of British ska, and fellow vocalist Arthur “Gaps” Hendrickson. Too much pressure!

title: THE SHAOLIN AFRONAUTS
description: Adelaide-based instrumental afrobeat band that is styled after Fela Kuti's Africa 70 band and Sun Ra

title: THE SHAOLIN AFRONAUTS
description: Afrobeat from Australia! Horn heavy and pretty damn funky sounds from this engaging and spaced out crew.

title: THE SHELLAC SISTERS
description: The glamourous retrochic spinning vintage 78's on wind up gramophones.

title: THE SHELLAC SISTERS
description: The glamourous retrochic spinning vintage 78's on wind up gramophones.

title: THE SHELLAC SISTERS
description: The glamourous retrochic spinning vintage 78's on wind up gramophones.

title: THE SMYTHS
description: They said it couldn’t happen! Morrissey and Marr. And the other two. Wash away that Saturday night hangover with 40 minutes of Mancunian madness. William, it was really nothing.

title: THE STEPKIDS
description: It’s modern psychedelic soul as encountered on their two acclaimed albums on the Stones Throw label. With a nod to Steely Dan and Earth, Wind And Fire expect a plethora of good grooves from this US trio.

title: THE SUBWAYS
description: Another trio – they should have been on Friday on trio day. Hard to believe it’s nearly ten years since ‘Young For Eternity’. Currently working on album number four, expect more purely punky pop to jump around a lot to.

title: THE TUTS
description: Acclaimed as a female version of The Libertines, an all-girl punk trio who drop their “haitches” and come from ‘ayes, bringing more than a few pop nuggets.

title: THE TWO WRONGIES HOST THE PIT CABARET
THE VODKA JELLIES LIVE KARAOKE BAND PLUS VERY SPECIAL GUESTS
THE WAILERS
description: Bob Marley And The Wailers were at the heart of the global reggae revolution in the late 1960s and early 1970s. Now fronted by original member Aston ‘Family Man’ Barrett, they are still generating authentic roots reggae gyrations, a timeless and evocative experience.

title: THE WAR ON DRUGS
description: Turn up the reverb! Brooding and just a little bit melancholy inside their lush shoegazing soundscapes, the Philadelphia four-piece offer maximum atmosphere on some slowly spiraling grooves. Far out!

title: THE WHITE LAMP
description: New project of Darren Emerson (underworld) with Along with Bristol Singer/Producer Pete Josef and with live drums and percussion. Expect everything from live tribal drum driven offerings, to deep soulful house, and even sprinklings of that classic techno sound from Darren at the helm. The White Lamp is the brain child of legendary House & Techno DJ, Darren Emerson.

title: THE WOOD BURNING SAVAGES
description: Supercharged alternative rock from Northern Ireland with some fuzzy guitar and an assured take on things.

title: THE WYTCHES
description: Heavy psyche rock from this super young three piece harking back to the great daze of Atomic Rooster, The Pretty Things and The Incredible Hog! Chunky riffs and lots of hair.

title: THEA GILMORE
description: With the days of voice and guitar and her dalliance with Sandy Denny behind her, last year’s ‘Regardless’ album was Thea Gilmore’s most complete outing yet, like the album Kate Bush never made.

title: THUNDERBIRDS ARE GO
description: An all-star band assembled especially for Glastonbury - featuring members of Portishead, Goldfrapp and Get the Blessing - presenting the genius music of Barry Gray, including Thunderbirds, Joe 90, Captain Scarlet and The Mysterons. Bring a ray gun.

title: TIGA
description: Montreal born producer and DJ with a lengthy career behind him and credits that include remixes for LCD SoundSystem, Scissor Sisters, Peaches and a whole lot more.

title: TIME TO ACT, ONE MILLION CLIMATE JOBS CAMPAIGN
TINARIWEN
description: Having relocated to Joshua Tree national park in California to record their sixth album, these Grammy-winning Tuareg musicians seem to have soaked up some of the frazzled psychedelia of America and mixed into their trance-like music.

title: TODDLA T TAKEOVER - BOAT PARTY PRESENTS TODDLA T, REDLIGHT, GOTSOME AND JUS NOW
description: With his own TV channel, label and show on Radio 1 Toddla T takes time out for a lengthy early session with Redlight, Gotsome and Jus Now all putting in a shift.

title: TOKIMONSTA
description: The brainchild of LA native Jennifer Lee, supercharging hip-hop, electronica, funk and jazz into new realms with some splintered samples and echoey mixes.

title: TONY JOE WHITE
description: An original ‘60s country soul man whose brooding delivery remains gritty and unnerving. A southern boogie permeates his sound and his tales from the wrong side of the trailer park still sound like the best bar room gossip set to music.

title: TOUMANI & SIDIKI
description: Father and son Diabate (Toumani being the greatest kora player alive) have teamed up to record together and to play this special live show for Sunday’s Pyramid stage with a multi-layered and truly emotional wash of strings.

title: TOY
description: And don’t miss this! If ever a group came of age, it’s TOY on their latest album ‘Join The Dots’ If Fujiya & Miyagi are Can, then TOY are Neu. And it rhymes. Superb!

title: TROKER
description: Tequila-fuelled, genre-busting musical revolutionaries from Mexico deliver horn-riddled jazz sounds that stray from moody soundscapes to upbeat freak outs.

title: TROUMACA
description: DIY specialists as likely to draw on Radiohead as they are on Caribbean Gospel, bass culture or grime.

title: TUNE-YARDS
description: Merrill Garbus is a unique talent, looping sounds and rhythms into punchy anthems, with her playful childlike delivery and some caustic observations on life. It’s like New York’s No Wave reborn. A truly memorable live experience that sounds like nothing else. A must see!

title: TURTLE ISLAND
description: Spectacular 17-piece Japanese orchestra - like a head-on collision of punk rock and traditional drumming! Guaranteed to be an anarchic visual treat with handy chantalong choruses so that everyone can start the party early.

title: TWO RIVERS - RAVI JI & AIDRIAN FREEDMAN
UP CLOSE WITH CONGO NATTY AND FRIENDS
UP CLOSE WITH TOM FINDLAY AND FRIENDS
VANCE JOY
description: There’s a twang to this Australian singer/songwriter’s vocal that recalls Loudon (father of Rufus and Martha) Wainwright III and his songs are similarly entertaining.

title: VINTAGE TROUBLE
description: “One of the best live bands on this planet!” An LA four-piece from that sweet spot where funk ‘n’ soul meets rock ‘n’ roll.

title: VINYL JUNKIE VS SANXION FEAT MC RIBBS
VIOLET SKIES
description: A bittersweet Welsh singer/songwriter as much inspired by Joni Mitchell as classical piano, or the soundscapes of James Blake and Massive Attack. A spine-tingling voice over the thrub of trip-hoppy drum and bass.

title: VIRUS RECORDINGS TAKEOVER OPTIV & BTK (BLACKJACK LP SHOWCASE)
WARPAINT
description: Expect more cerebral, floating Fleetwood Mac-style atmosphere from this all girl four piece whose hypnotic harmonies and feather light mix make them one of the most brittle and cherished live experiences around.

title: WAZE & ODYSSEY
description: Electronic dance music pioneers and remixers (Disclosure, TEED), championed by the Feel My Bicep team among many others.

title: WE WERE EVERGREEN
description: These Parisians make those kind of songs that worm their way into your psyche, clever intricate arrangements that appear to defy genres and make huge tunes, far bigger than seems humanly possible.

title: WHAT THE LADYBIRD HEARD BY JULIA DONALDSON
WHAT THE LADYBIRD HEARD BY JULIA DONALDSON
WHITE LIES
description: You have to say that there’s as symphonic grandeur to White Lies. Big songs, big wafts of synth and Harry McVeigh’s booming vocal carrying the proceedings forward with some gusto.

title: WILD BEASTS
description: There’s an aura of edgy grandiosity about some of the Wild Beasts’ songs, the layered synths, the pounding drums, the clinical vocal lines all make for an uplifting and blissful sound that tingles in your chest long after they’ve evaporated.

title: WILKINSON + AD-APT
description: After blowing up with the gorgeously soulful ‘Afterglow’ that added new dimensions to drum and bass, expect more eclectic work from Wilkinson and his chosen MC.

title: WOLF ALICE
description: Lo-fi rocking and good time music with a sense of humour and plenty of shouting when needed. That said, it’s the purity of Ellie Roswell’s vocal that carries the sound, here on songs that are succinctly fashioned into hummable gems.

title: WORLD'S TALLEST DJ'S BRASS BAND REMIX
WORLD'S TALLEST DJ'S BRASS BAND REMIX
YASMINE HAMDAN
description: Yasmine is a uniquely important artist to the middle east, hailing from the Beirut underground scene and singing pop songs in Arabic, and collaborating with the likes of Cocorosie.

title: YOKO ONO PLASTIC ONO BAND
description: The artist, film maker and peace activist continues to perform as The Plastic Ono Band with a rotating cats of fellow players. This will be one of the moments of the weekend for sure.

title: YOUNG FATHERS
description: This is a weird collision of styles, a three piece alternative hip hop outfit from Edinburgh who sound like a modern day De La Soul, adding noise rock and a soulful chorus to make a compulsive brew that is pretty hard to pigeonhole.

title: YOUNG KNIVES
description: The sound of swinging Ashby-de-la-Zouch, from this very English and suitably eccentric trio whose punky indie rock remains suitably angular and awkward in the best possible way.

title: YOUTH FILM ACADEMY - FILM MAKING MASTERCLASS
YOUTH FILM ACADEMY - FILM MAKING MASTERCLASS
ZION TRAIN – 25 YEARS, DUBWISE NO COMPROMISE
